   (a) The White House said the incident was a provocation and raised an objection with Beijing.

2. Option (a) is a single event, while option (b) is a conjunction of two events: the White House raising an objection (event A) and emphasizing the U.S. commitment to freedom of navigation (event B).

So, based on probabilistic reasoning and ignoring the representativeness heuristic, the correct answer is (a) The White House said the incident was a provocation and raised an objection with Beijing, as it is more likely than the conjunction presented in option (b).
